title: Thriller film sinks teeth into Hungary's opposition
description: It is a film perfectly timed for Viktor Orban's ruling party that could harm the opposition.

title: Should sex offenders' voices ever be heard?
description: Audio clips from child sex offenders are released by police to deter others following in their path.

title: Covid-19 vaccines: Has China made more than other countries combined?
description: China says it's provided more than half of all vaccines administered around the world so far.

title: Newcastle United takeover: What is PIF, the main owner of the club?
description: Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund owns 80% of Newcastle after a high-profile takeover.

title: Biodiversity loss risks 'ecological meltdown' - scientists
description: The UK has an average of only 53% of its biodiversity left, well below the global average, study shows.

title: Your pictures on the theme of 'derelict'
description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

title: The 25-year-old who's been a clown for two decades
description: Lucien Santus started performing as a clown when he was four years old.

title: 'Why drilling holes in fences can save hedgehogs'
description: Jennifer Manning-Ohren is turning her community into a highway to help the endangered creatures.

title: Oh Wonder: We spent our honeymoon covered in cockroaches in a burning building
description: The indie-pop duo broke up while recording their fourth album, and things only got weirder after that.

title: Nobel Peace Prize 'for Russian journalists who lost their lives'
description: Dmitry Muratov dedicates the Nobel Peace Prize to Russian journalists killed in the line of duty.

description: Here's a look at some of the stories you may have missed this week.

title: Gas prices: Energy price cap call for small and medium firms
description: Businesses say the UK has reached a crisis point over the price of gas and are calling for support.

title: Chris Packham calls on Royal Family to rewild estates
description: A petition urges the royals to conserve nature and reintroduce animals on their estates.

title: Mary Phillip: First black woman to captain England now a successful men's coach
description: Mary Phillip - the first black woman to captain England - talks to BBC Sport about being a history-maker as a player and coach.

description: Three fathers doing a charity walk receive a donation from film star Daniel Craig as they set out.

title: Sarah Everard: BT 888 phone service floated to protect lone women
description: The service would track users and trigger an alert if they did not reach their destination.

title: Emma Raducanu: Briton loses first match since US Open win
description: Emma Raducanu loses her first match since her US Open triumph, losing to Belarus' Aliaksandra Sasnovich in straight sets in the second round at Indian Wells.

title: More than 500 Covid cases linked to TRNSMT festival
description: Public Health Scotland says 551 people who tested positive for the virus were at the festival around the time of their illness.

title: Luxury student complex in Glasgow 'unfinished and filthy'
description: Students in Glasgow have complained to the provider about holes in floors, construction dust and flooding.

description: Tyson Fury and Deontay Wilder exchange heated words at the weigh-in before their third world heavyweight title fight.

description: Taiwan dismisses the Chinese leader's remarks, saying its future lies in the hands of its people.

description: Britain's Emma Raducanu loses on her return to court for the first time since her US Open triumph.

title: Finn's Law: Five years after stabbing, ex-police dog is still campaigning
description: Five years on from an attack that led to a law change, former police dog Finn is still campaigning.

title: Texas abortion: US appeals court reinstates near total ban
description: It comes two days after a lower court blocked the law, which bans abortions at six weeks of pregnancy.

title: Nadhim Zahawi vows to tackle persistent pupil absences 'head on'
